results.adx_keywords: Television;Content Type: Personal Profile;Alcock, Milly (2000- );Carey, Emily (2003- )
results.title: ‘House of the Dragon’ Stars Say Goodbye to HBO’s Biggest Hit
results.abstract: In a joint interview, Milly Alcock and Emily Carey discussed their now-completed stint in the HBO epic. “We were forced to hang on to each other for dear life,” Alcock said.

media.caption: “We’re very lucky in that we get along in real life, so the chemistry came very organically,” Carey said.
media.copyright: Kalpesh Lathigra for The New York Times

results.title: Sweden Is Becoming Unbearable
results.abstract: The idea of Sweden as a land of equal opportunity, safe from the plagues of extreme left or extreme right that haunt other countries, is gone.

media.caption: Supporters of the Sweden Democrats political party during its election night rally.

results.adx_keywords: Frauds and Swindling;Nonprofit Organizations;Federal Aid (US);Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Children and Childhood;United States Politics and Government;Feeding Our Future;Federal Bureau of Investigation;Justice Department
results.title: Justice Dept. Charges 48 in Brazen Pandemic Aid Fraud in Minnesota
results.abstract: The defendants were charged with stealing $240 million intended to feed children, in what appears to be the largest theft so far from a pandemic-era program.

media.caption: The indictments said the defendants had pulled in millions of dollars a week by taking money from federal anti-hunger programs for meals they never served.

results.title: Criminal Investigation Is Opened After Migrant Flights to Martha’s Vineyard
results.abstract: The sheriff of Bexar County, Texas, said it was clear that many of the 48 migrants flown to Massachusetts had been misled and lured away to score political points.

media.caption: “They had a right not to be preyed on and played for a fool,” Sheriff Javier Salazar of Bexar County said.
media.copyright: Sam Owens/The San Antonio Express-News via AP

results.title: Judge Vacates Murder Conviction of Adnan Syed of ‘Serial’
results.abstract: Mr. Syed, 41, had been serving a life sentence for the 1999 murder of his high school classmate Hae Min Lee. The judge gave prosecutors 30 days to proceed with a new trial or drop the case.
